name: 123 Notetaker AI Free

HIPAA.details: Microsoft documentation explicitly states no HIPAA compliance
HIPAA.limitations: Not applicable - tool not designed for healthcare use

GDPR.details: Privacy policy updated for GDPR requirements, includes data subject rights
GDPR.limitations: EU data residency handled through AWS infrastructure

SOC_2.details: Microsoft documentation shows no SOC 2 compliance certifications
SOC_2.limitations: Enterprise controls limited without SOC 2 certification

ISO_27001.limitations: Information security management system not certified

PCI_DSS.details: Tool does not process payment card data
PCI_DSS.evidence: Documentation review shows no payment processing
PCI_DSS.limitations: Not applicable to meeting transcription functionality

CCPA.details: Privacy policy includes CCPA rights for California residents

FedRAMP.limitations: Not suitable for government use cases requiring FedRAMP

summary_and_recommendation: 123 Notetaker AI Free scores 42 points (Medium Risk). Key strengths include explicit no-training policy, strong data retention practices (<30 days), and comprehensive privacy policy. Main concerns are lack of enterprise admin controls and absence of major compliance certifications (SOC 2, ISO 27001). The tool processes meeting audio/video but stores data in US with good security practices. Recommend: Approve with standard enterprise controls for general business meetings, avoid for highly confidential content requiring SOC 2 compliance.
primary_use_case: Meeting transcription and note-taking for Microsoft Teams
data_classification: Meeting content, audio/video recordings, user identifiers
documentation_tier: Tier 2: Private enterprise documentation via Microsoft certification plus comprehensive privacy policy
assessment_notes: High confidence due to detailed Microsoft certification documentation and comprehensive privacy policy. All major security questions answered with verifiable sources.

recommended_restrictions: Avoid for SOC 2 required use cases

recommendations.title: Implement for general business meetings
recommendations.description: Tool shows good security practices and clear data handling. Suitable for standard business meetings with appropriate user consent.

recommendations.title: Monitor for enterprise admin features
recommendations.description: While the free version lacks enterprise controls, monitor for premium versions that may offer centralized administration.

recommendations.title: Avoid for compliance-sensitive use cases
recommendations.description: Due to lack of SOC 2 and ISO 27001 certifications, avoid for use cases requiring these compliance standards.

detailed_assessment.compliance_summary: This tool complies with GDPR, CCPA, and PII handling requirements but lacks SOC 2, ISO 27001, and HIPAA certifications.
detailed_assessment.summary_and_recommendation: 123 Notetaker AI Free scores 42 points (Medium Risk). Key strengths include explicit no-training policy, strong data retention practices (<30 days), and comprehensive privacy policy. Main concerns are lack of enterprise admin controls and absence of major compliance certifications (SOC 2, ISO 27001). The tool processes meeting audio/video but stores data in US with good security practices. Recommend: Approve with standard enterprise controls for general business meetings, avoid for highly confidential content requiring SOC 2 compliance.

geographic_control.justification: Known secure regions (US) with contracts. Microsoft documentation confirms data stored in 'United States of America' with established data management processes and AWS infrastructure.

encryption_standards.justification: Basic Encryption - TLS encryption in transit confirmed. Microsoft documentation shows 'TLS 1.1 or higher' support. Privacy policy mentions security safeguards but limited technical encryption details published.

data_retention.justification: Customer-Controlled Retention - Privacy policy explicitly states transcriptions and notes 'can be deleted by the user at any time' with <30 days retention after account termination. Strong user control over data lifecycle.

model_training.justification: Contractual guarantee of no training use. Privacy policy explicitly states 'No user data is used to train AI models without the user's explicit consent' providing strong protection against unwanted model training.

data_sharing.justification: No third-party sharing. Privacy policy clearly states 'We do not share, sell, or disclose your personal information to unaffiliated parties for marketing or commercial purposes' and Microsoft documentation confirms 'No' to third-party transfers.

admin_management.justification: Limited Controls - Microsoft documentation shows 'No' to Microsoft identity platform integration for free version. No enterprise admin controls or centralized management capabilities documented for free tier.

audit_capabilities.justification: Basic Auditing - Microsoft documentation confirms 'event logging set up on all system components' but limited organizational audit capabilities for free version. Logs reviewed regularly but limited export/reporting capabilities.

integration.justification: Limited Integration - Microsoft documentation shows 'No' to Microsoft identity platform integration. Works within Teams but lacks SSO, SCIM provisioning, and enterprise identity management features.

regulatory_violations.justification: Compliance Gaps - Microsoft documentation shows 'No' to all major enterprise compliance certifications (SOC 2, ISO 27001, HIPAA, FedRAMP). While good security practices are documented, lack of third-party certifications increases compliance risk.

data_processing_transparency.justification: Basic Transparency - Privacy policy provides clear data processing descriptions, retention periods, and third-party relationships. Microsoft documentation details data handling practices and geographic storage locations.

documentation_and_support.justification: Good Documentation - Comprehensive privacy policy updated June 2025 with detailed security practices. Microsoft certification provides extensive security documentation including penetration testing, disaster recovery, and incident response procedures.
